intro: Cryptantha gilliesii, commonly known as the Sierra cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and open habitats, such as meadows and slopes. It has a compact growth habit with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Cryptantha gilliesii is often found in the Sierra Nevada and other mountainous regions of California.
